revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Ready. Left \τὸ ὀψώνιον/ together in order not to disturb the fact that both are written above the end of line 6.

Vote - AcceptText - Ed.'s χορηγῶ <:τοὺς ἀνθρώπους|reg|ἀνθρώπω:> in lin10 is wrong. We need a dative (cf. LSJ s.v. 3b. 'c. acc. rei (with or without dat. pers.), supply, furnish'), and we have a dative (what it means, is a different story). No |reg| needed. || lin6 remove τὸ from the correction. || lin3 => <:εἰμὶ|reg|εἰμεὶ:> || lin12 => πλοῖ<ο>ν => <:πλοῖον|reg|πλοῖν:> | βοῦλῃ => βούλῃ

Vote - AcceptText - I agree with all proposals (though would appreciate a second opinion on the regularization of ἀνθρώπω in l. 10, which makes sense to me.) Finalizer, please also remove τὰ in line 10, as well, which is in neither the edition nor on the papyrus, but which reflects one suggestion in the commentary.
Submit - Corrections, fixing typos and regularizations.

Commit - Corrections in l. 6: the papyrus has ὀψώνιν not ὀψώνιον, l. 7 ποήσεις instead of ποιήσεις. Typos in l. 8 (Leiden double square brackets in μη not single brackets), l. 10 (the edition and the papyrus have διατάξεις not διατάξας and there are no ὀψώνια in the text. The syntax is simple καλῶς ποιήσεις διατάξεις (Future form) and the correct alternative is a Aor. participle διατάξας, διατάξειν should not be considered. Further, ἀνθρώπω could be easily a genitive plural with the final nu silenced esp. before a mu. χορηγῶ ἀνθρώπων μισθούς sounds fine.
